title: Google\Cloud\NetworkSecurity\V1beta1\ClientTlsPolicy
name: ClientTlsPolicy
description:
ClientTlsPolicy is a resource that specifies how a client should authenticate connections to backends of a service. This resource itself does not affect configuration unless it is attached to a backend service resource.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.networksecurity.v1beta1.ClientTlsPolicy

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.name
params.description: Required. Name of the ClientTlsPolicy resource. It matches the pattern projects/*/locations/{location}/clientTlsPolicies/{client_tls_policy}

params.name: data.create_time
params.description: Output only. The timestamp when the resource was created.

params.name: data.update_time
params.description: Output only. The timestamp when the resource was updated.

params.name: data.labels
params.description: Optional. Set of label tags associated with the resource.

params.name: data.sni
params.description: Optional. Server Name Indication string to present to the server during TLS handshake. E.g: "secure.example.com".

params.name: data.client_certificate
params.description: Optional. Defines a mechanism to provision client identity (public and private keys) for peer to peer authentication. The presence of this dictates mTLS.

params.name: data.server_validation_ca
params.description: Optional. Defines the mechanism to obtain the Certificate Authority certificate to validate the server certificate. If empty, client does not validate the server certificate.
